[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Clone amplification] Can repeated cloning of large PersistedValue objects throughout the codebase cause memory pressure and performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [DashMap shard contention] Can high contention on DashMap shards for db_cache, peer_quota, and persist_subscribers cause performance degradation during high load? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: generate_signed_batch_info()] [Signature malleability] Can signature generation at line 484 be vulnerable to malleability attacks where different signatures validate for the same batch, causing consensus issues? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: generate_signed_batch_info()] [Deterministic signature failure] Can ValidatorSigner produce non-deterministic signatures for the same batch_info, causing different validators to generate different signed batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: persist_inner()] [Signature-content mismatch] Can the signed batch_info at lines 515-519 differ from the persisted batch content, allowing signature verification to pass while storing malicious data? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Version migration vulnerability] Can v1 to v2 batch format migration be exploited to corrupt batches during the transition, causing data loss or consensus failures? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Partial write failure] Can db.save_batch() partially succeed (write to some tables but not others), leaving the database in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Delete-insert race in DB] Can db.delete_batches() race with db.save_batch() for the same digests, causing newly saved batches to be immediately deleted? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: gc_previous_epoch_batches_from_db_v1()] [Cross-epoch contamination] Can batches from epoch N be incorrectly persisted with epoch N-1 metadata, surviving garbage collection and contaminating new epochs? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Expiration buffer manipulation] Can expiration_buffer_usecs at line 125 be set to extreme values during initialization, causing all batches to appear expired or never expire? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Time monotonicity violation] Can system time rollback or NTP adjustments cause last_certified_time to violate monotonicity, breaking expiration logic? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: save()] [Expiration boundary condition] Can batches with expiration exactly equal to last_certified_time cause off-by-one errors in expiration checks throughout the codebase? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: clear_expired_payload()] [Saturating subtraction edge case] Can saturating_sub at line 446 cause expiration_time to be 0 if expiration_buffer_usecs > certified_time, deleting all batches? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: insert_to_cache()] [Peer quota hijacking] Can an attacker impersonate another peer's author identity to consume their quota allocation, preventing legitimate batches from that peer? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: free_quota()] [Missing peer panic] Can the expect() at line 345 panic if the peer's quota manager was removed, causing validator crashes during quota freeing? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: exists()] [PeerId spoofing] Can the returned PeerId from exists() be spoofed or manipulated, causing incorrect author attribution for batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_store.rs] [Function: get_or_fetch_batch()] [Responder manipulation] Can malicious responders in the Vec<PeerId> be used to poison routing tables or cause batch requests to timeout? (Medium)
